task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 341°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: The current pitch is 0°, so the top of the building may not be fully visible; rotating up will help reveal the roofline for height estimation.
The current pitch is 30° up, which likely shows the building's roof but not its base; rotating down will reveal the ground level to estimate total height from base to roof.
The building's base is visible at 60° down and roof was visible at 30° up, creating a 90° vertical span; using trigonometry with estimated distance, the height is approximately 24 meters.
